kms_account_key_arn.description: The [ARN](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-arns-and-namespaces.html) of the default [KMS](https://aws.amazon.com/kms/) key (this is what handles encryption for redis, documentdb, eks, etc…)

kms_account_key_id.description: The [ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/find-cmk-id-arn.html) of the default KMS key (sometimes things need the ID, sometimes the ARN, so we’re giving both)

vpc_id.description: The ID of the [VPC](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/what-is-amazon-vpc.html) we created for this environment

private_subnet_ids.description: The IDs of the private [subnets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_Subnets.html) we setup for your environment

public_subnets_ids.description: The IDs of the public [subnets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_Subnets.html) we setup for your environment

s3_log_bucket_name.description: The name of the default logging bucket provisioned by opta

public_nat_ips.description: Public static IP of nat gateway(s)
